awd_titl_txt: A New Vascular Model for Whole Limb Heat Transfer
awd_abstract_narration: There are numerous and important areas of human medicine where heat             transfer plays a major role.  The study to be performed deals with such         an area.  A thermal model of an entire limb will be developed which             will take account of a complex vascular organization.  The predictions          of the model will be compared with experiments involving the hand and           the arm.  If successful, the model will yield a greatly improved                quantitative interpretation of physiological measurements and will              enable more accurate predictions of whole limb heat transfer both for           thermoneutral conditions and conditions of thermal stress.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
